application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Works to trees covered by LBE ORDER NO 271: PROPOSAL A - 1x cherry (T2), 6x yew (G3), mixed group of 20x laurel and yew (G4) and 1x yew (T5) - prune back NNW side to achieve 0.5m clearance from street lamp, 1x sycamore (T3) and 1x hawthorn (T6) - fell, 1x whitebeam (T13) - remove stake, 2x alder (T26 and T27) - prune up to 0.4m, 1x sugar maple (T31) - crown thin up to 25% in the upper canopy, 3x poplar (T36, T37 and T38) re-pollard trees to previous pollard points, up to 4m,  and 1x cherry (T19) crown reduction up to 1m. PROPOSAL B; 1x ash (T42) crown reduction up to 2m
decision_conditions: This consent is valid for two years.Reason: In order that the nature of work pertaining to this consent remains appropriate.

The works hereby approved shall only be carried out strictly in accordance with British Standard 3998 [2010] 'Tree Works'.Reason: In the interests of the health, safety and appearance of the preserved trees.

Tree work should not be carried out during periods that are likely to interfere with or disturb breeding birds or mammals.Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981) and Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations (2010).
No reason has been provided for the proposed crown reduction of T42 ash, and therefore works are not justified.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet)
